title: Kaldi's Coffee - Single Serve

parameters.grind_size: Medium-fine, aiming for a grind that allows for a long, steady pour with a slight pool of water on top.

preparation_steps: Rinse V60 filter with hot water, discard rinse water.
Add coffee, shake to level, create center divot.

brewing_steps.instruction: Bloom: Pour 40mL water into center divot, then swirl and stir.
brewing_steps.short_instruction: Bloom 40mL water • Swirl brewer & stir bed
brewing_steps.audio_script: Pour 40 milliliters of hot water directly into that center divot you created. Pour slowly and steadily, watching as the coffee begins to bloom and release carbon dioxide. Give the V60 a gentle swirl, then stir the bed. This crucial step ensures even saturation.

brewing_steps.instruction: Main Pour: Pour aggressively into center, then swirl to edges. Target 75mL.
brewing_steps.short_instruction: Main pour 75mL aggressively • Swirl to edges
brewing_steps.audio_script: You have 30 seconds for the main pour - this is where V60 technique truly shines. Pour aggressively into the center, then spiral outward to the edges. We're targeting 75 milliliters total. Maintain that aggressive flow rate to create turbulence in the coffee bed.

brewing_steps.instruction: Stop pouring and give a gentle swirl to flatten the bed.
brewing_steps.short_instruction: Stop pouring • Gentle swirl to flatten bed
brewing_steps.audio_script: In 15 seconds, stop pouring and set your kettle aside. Take a moment to pause and observe the coffee bed. Notice how it's actively bubbling and extracting. Now give your V60 dripper a gentle swirl to flatten the coffee bed for even distribution.

brewing_steps.instruction: Final Pour: Pour gently in center with small circles until 256mL.
brewing_steps.short_instruction: Final pour to 256mL • Small circles in center
brewing_steps.audio_script: Now for the final pour! Take 60 seconds to pour much more gently than before. Start in the center of the coffee bed and make small, controlled circles with your kettle. Keep the pour steady and controlled as you work your way up to 256 milliliters total. Watch your scale closely.

brewing_steps.instruction: Final swirl to flatten bed for drain down.
brewing_steps.short_instruction: Final swirl • Flatten bed for drain
brewing_steps.audio_script: Finally, give your V60 dripper one last gentle swirl to flatten the coffee bed completely. You have 30 seconds. Now watch as the coffee bed settles into a nice, flat surface. Let gravity do its work - the coffee will drain down through the filter at its own natural pace.

what_to_expect.description: Kaldi's Coffee V60 method is a beginner-friendly approach that emphasizes simplicity and consistency. This technique uses a straightforward 2.5:1 bloom ratio followed by an aggressive main pour and a gentle final pour. The method is designed to be forgiving while still producing excellent results. Expect a clean, balanced cup with good body and clarity. The aggressive main pour creates turbulence for even extraction, while the gentle final pour ensures you don't over-extract. This method works well with medium to dark roasts and is perfect for those new to V60 brewing. The consistent timing and clear steps make it easy to reproduce great coffee every time.
